Variable.doc: Logger object used within the Spoon. Can be accessed to set the default log level for the messages coming from the Spoon.

Variable.doc: Table containing all active directory watchers. This is managed internally by the Spoon.
Variable.desc: Table containing all active directory watchers. This is managed internally by the Spoon.

Variable.name: watchers

desc: File organization spoon that watches directories and moves files based on rules
doc:
File organization spoon that watches directories and moves files based on rules

Download: [https://github.com/Hammerspoon/Spoons/raw/master/Spoons/FileWatcher.spoon.zip](https://github.com/Hammerspoon/Spoons/raw/master/Spoons/FileWatcher.spoon.zip)

Method.doc:
Initialize the spoon

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * The FileWatcher object
Method.name: init

Method.doc:
Process a single file according to the given rules

Parameters:
 * file - Full path to the file
 * rules - Array of rules to apply

Returns:
 * true if file was processed successfully, false otherwise
Method.desc: Process a single file according to the given rules
stripped_doc: Process a single file according to the given rules
returns: * true if file was processed successfully, false otherwise
Method.name: processFile
parameters: * file - Full path to the file
* rules - Array of rules to apply

Method.doc:
Start watching a directory with the specified rules

Parameters:
 * directory - Directory path to watch
 * rules - Array of rules to apply to matching files

Returns:
 * The FileWatcher object

Notes:
 * Each rule should be a table with the following keys:
   * pattern - Lua pattern to match filename (case-insensitive)
   * destination - Path where matching files should be moved
   * action - (optional) Action to take, currently only "move" is supported (default: "move")
 * The directory path can use tilde (~) for the home directory
 * Files are moved automatically when they appear in the watched directory
 * If a file with the same name exists at the destination, a number will be appended
Method.desc: Start watching a directory with the specified rules
stripped_doc: Start watching a directory with the specified rules
notes: * Each rule should be a table with the following keys:
* pattern - Lua pattern to match filename (case-insensitive)
* destination - Path where matching files should be moved
* action - (optional) Action to take, currently only "move" is supported (default: "move")
* The directory path can use tilde (~) for the home directory
* Files are moved automatically when they appear in the watched directory
* If a file with the same name exists at the destination, a number will be appended
Method.name: watchDirectory
parameters: * rules - Array of rules to apply to matching files

Method.doc:
Stop watching a directory

Parameters:
 * directory - Directory path to stop watching

Returns:
 * The FileWatcher object
Method.name: stopWatching
parameters: * directory - Directory path to stop watching

Method.doc:
Stop all directory watchers

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * The FileWatcher object
Method.name: stopAllWatchers

Method.doc:
Starts all configured directory watchers

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * The FileWatcher object

Notes:
 * This method is provided for consistency with other Spoons
 * Watchers are automatically started when you call :watchDirectory()
 * This method is useful if you've stopped all watchers and want to restart them
notes: * This method is provided for consistency with other Spoons
* Watchers are automatically started when you call :watchDirectory()
* This method is useful if you've stopped all watchers and want to restart them
Method.name: start

Method.doc:
Stops all directory watchers

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * The FileWatcher object
Method.name: stop
